item.title: My-Hero-Academia Ep 1 - Izuku Midoriya: Origin

component.name: Origin
component.script:
sub init() videocontent = createObject("RoSGNode", "ContentNode")
videocontent.title = "Ep 1 - Izuku Midoriya: Origin" videocontent.streamformat = "mp4" videocontent.url = "https://om165.cdn.oose.io/play/a201801044MY7BlUVR14/video.mp4?rate=512k&attach=%5Bwww.watchmha.%5DEP_1_DUB_HD).mp4"
video = m.top.findNode("episodeOrigin") video.content = videocontent
video.setFocus(true) video.control = "play" end sub

item.synopsis: Psychopathic killers are the basis for some must-watch TV, but what really makes them tick? Neuroscientist Jim Fallon talks about brain scans and genetic analysis that may uncover the rotten wiring in the nature (and nurture) of murderers. In a too-strange-for-fiction twist, he shares a fascinating family history that makes his work chillingly personal.

item.title: Dan Gilbert asks, Why are we happy?
item.synopsis: Harvard psychologist Dan Gilbert says our beliefs about what will make us happy are often wrong -- a premise he supports with intriguing research, and explains in his accessible and unexpectedly funny book, Stumbling on Happiness.

item.title: VS Ramachandran on your mind
item.synopsis: Vilayanur Ramachandran tells us what brain damage can reveal about the connection between celebral tissue and the mind, using three startling delusions as examples.
